Key Match Events: Marcus Semien hit a two-run triple and a three-run home run, giving Texas Rangers a 10-run lead by the third inning.
Corey Seager hit a two-run home run in the second inning and another long home run in the third inning.
Travis Jankowski replaced Adolis García in right field and hit a two-run double in the third inning.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a three-run homer in the eighth inning and a sacrifice fly in the fourth.
Tommy Pham had a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning, and Gabriel Moreno delivered a two-run single in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Adolis García gathered Texas Rangers hitters in a clubhouse side room and told them his World Series was over.
Max Scherzer was finished due to injuries, and the American League champions lost their top slugger and potential Game 7 starting pitcher.
Travis Jankowski said he was locked in last night waiting, preparing to start, and didn’t get the official news until 2 o'clock today.
Miguel Castro’s wild pitch brought home the first run, and an error by Gold Glove first baseman Christian Walker led to five unearned runs in the third inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Forty-two of 49 previous teams to take 3-1 leads have gone on to win the World Series.
The most recent club to overcome a 3-1 deficit was the Chicago Cubs against Cleveland in 2016.
Nathan Eovaldi is expected to start for the Texas Rangers in the upcoming Game 7.
Andrew Heaney, a 32-year-old lefty with his fifth big league team, earned the win by allowing four hits in five innings.
